alert.note: Alert for Itawamba (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 24 at 10:14PM CDT until March 24 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN ITAWAMBA...SOUTHERN TISHOMINGO AND SOUTHEASTERN PRENTISS COUNTIES... At 1013 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Burton, or 7 miles west of Tishomingo State Park, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Tishomingo State Park, Belmont, Tishomingo, Sandy Springs, Burton, Midway, Marietta, Golden, Paden, Thrasher, Dennis, Moores Mill, Bloody Springs, Kirkville, Carter Branch, Mingo, Hobo Station, Petertown, Neil and Altitude. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Tornadoes are extremely difficult to see and confirm at night. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW!
